name: Dunya Rahim
about:
I’m an Information Science student at the University of Maryland with a passion for turning ideas into real, working products. My background blends web development, data analysis, and problem-solving, from building responsive sites to analyzing 300k+ data records in SQL.

I’ve created tools like a Pinterest Engagement CLI for data visualization, a TaskTrackr command-line app for productivity, and SQL projects uncovering local crime trends. These projects not only sharpened my technical skills in JavaScript, Python, and databases, but also taught me how to design user-friendly experiences and write clean, maintainable code.

Beyond coding, I enjoy experimenting with new tech, learning product thinking, and finding ways to make digital experiences both useful and visually appealing. I’m always looking for challenges that push me to grow, whether it’s integrating APIs, optimizing database queries, or creating something from scratch that people actually want to use.

projects.name: Pinterest Engagement CLI
projects.description: Analyzes engagement trends (likes, comments) from CSV using SQLite and Matplotlib.

projects.name: TaskTrackr (CLI)
projects.description: Command-line to-do tracker with priorities and due dates using argparse and JSON; includes unit tests.

projects.name: Montgomery County Crime SQL Analysis
projects.description: SQL analysis of 300k+ records to find trends by ZIP, agency, and crime type; led ERD design and normalization.

projects.name: Mini Portfolio Generator
projects.description: A personal portfolio website built with vanilla JS, HTML, and CSS, generating all content from a JSON file. Fully responsive and hosted with GitHub Pages.

projects.name: 5-Day Weather Forecast CLI
projects.description: API-based CLI that fetches and prints a five-day forecast using OpenWeatherMap.

experience.summary: Built responsive web interfaces and integrated APIs; provided technical support and basic troubleshooting; collaborated with backend developers and contributed to process efficiency.
Conducted research on digital collections focused on metadata standards and digital preservation; performed data analysis to evaluate archival methods.
Troubleshot hardware and software issues; supported IT systems management; improved user experience.
